translated: In the hearts of Akṣobhya, Amoghasiddhi, Amitābha, Ratnasaṃbhava, and Vairocana, on a moon or sun as appropriate, are the seed syllables huṃ, āṃ, jriṃ, khaṃ, and hūṃ.

original: locanādidevīnāṃ Ioṃ māṃ pāṃ tāṃ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ khaṃ raṃ /
analyzed: locana ādi devīnām ioṃ mām pām tām jaḥ   vaṃ hoḥ khaṃ raṃ
translated: For the goddesses beginning with Locanā, the seed syllables are i oṃ, maṃ, paṃ, tāṃ, jaḥ, hūṃ, vaṃ, hoḥ, khaṃ, and raṃ.

analyzed: krodhānām hūm
translated: For the wrathful ones, the seed syllable is hūṃ.

analyzed: sarva devatānām hṛdaya mantrāḥ vajrāvalyām uktāḥ  am
translated: The heart mantras of all the deities are stated in the Vajra Rosary.

original: iha niṣpannayoginaś cakṣurādyadhiṣṭhānaṃ jñānasattvapraveśādikaṃ ca noktam //
analyzed: iha niṣpanna yoginaḥ cakṣuḥ ādi adhiṣṭhānam jñāna sattva praveśa ādikam ca na uktam
translated: Here, for accomplished yogis, the consecration of the eyes and so on, and the entry of the Knowledge Being and so forth, are not mentioned.

original: tadantareṇāpy aparimitācintyacakṣurabhijñādiguṇagrāmaramaṇīyamūrter abhīṣṭadevatāyāḥ sakṛd eva supariśuddhasarvākārapariniṣpatter muhur muhur 🔽adhimokṣadārḍhyāt /
analyzed: tad antareṇa api aparimita acintya cakṣuḥ abhijñā ādi guṇa grāma ramaṇīya mūrteḥ abhīṣṭadevatāyāḥ sakṛt eva su pariśuddha sarva ākāra pariniṣpatteḥ muhur muhur  adhimokṣa dārḍhyāt
translated: Even without that, by the firmness of repeated resolve, the form of the desired deity, delightful with the multitude of qualities such as the immeasurable and inconceivable eye-superknowledge and so on, is perfectly accomplished in every way, again and again.

analyzed: hṛd mantra ādi kathanam tu kalaśa adhivāsana ādiṣu prayoga artham
translated: The statement of the heart mantra and so on is for the purpose of the ritual in the consecration of the ritual vase and so on.

original: yadā tu madhye 'nyas tathāgato bhavati nāyakas tadā madhyasthitas tasya sthāne tiṣṭhet /
analyzed: yadā tu madhye nyaḥ tathāgataḥ bhavati nāyakaḥ tadā madhya sthitaḥ tasya sthāne tiṣṭhet
translated: But when there is another Tathāgata in the middle as the leader, then he should stand in his place in the middle.

original: amitābhaḥ śubhro 'pi bhavati śuklā dharmāḥ prakṛtyeti vāgīśasyātra śuklatety ukteḥ //
analyzed: amita ābhaḥ bhavati śuklāḥ dharmāḥ prakṛtyā iti vāgīśasya atra śukla tā iti ukteḥ
translated: Amitābha is also white, because white dharmas are by nature, as stated in the Vāgīśa section here.

original: iha vakṣyamāneṣu ca mandaleṣu yasyā māṇḍaleyadevatāyā mukhyato yatsthānam ucyate tasmin saiva pradhānatayā maṇḍaleśabhimukhī /
analyzed: iha vakṣyamāneṣu ca mandaleṣu yasyāḥ māṇḍaleya devatāyāḥ mukhyatas yat sthānam ucyate tasmin sā eva pradhāna tayā maṇḍaleśa abhimukhī
translated: And in the maṇḍalas that will be described here, the maṇḍala deity for whom a particular place is primarily mentioned, she herself is primarily facing the maṇḍaleshvara in that place.

analyzed: tad āliṅgitā tu tad abhimukhī eva para sthāna gamanāt
translated: But when embraced by him, she is facing him alone, because she has gone to his place.

original: atra kūṭāgārasya vajrabhūmyādiparito vajrapañjaraṃ rakṣācakraṃ dharmodayā ceti trayaḥ parikarāḥ /
analyzed: atra kūṭāgārasya vajra bhūmi ādi paritas vajra pañjaram rakṣā cakram dharma udayā ca iti trayaḥ parikarāḥ
translated: Here, the pavilion has three accessories: the vajra ground, etc., the vajra fence, and the protection wheel, and the dharma source.

original: tatra vajrapañjaraṃ vakṣyamānānām api sarveṣāṃ kūṭāgārāṇāṃ rakṣācakraṃ Am
analyzed: tatra vajra pañjaram vakṣyamānānām api sarveṣām kūṭāgārāṇām rakṣā cakram
translated: Among them, the vajra fence is the protection wheel for all the pavilions that will be described,

analyzed: dharma udayā ca keṣāṃcid eva iti vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: and the dharma source is for some of them. We will describe this.

original: lekhyakūṭāgārāṇāṃ tu dharmadhātusvarūpadharmodayāyā dharmadhātvantargatasya vā sūcakaṃ likhanam uktaṃ vajrāvalyām //
analyzed: lekhya kūṭāgārāṇām tu dharmadhātu svarūpa dharma udayāyāḥ dharmadhātu antargatasya vā sūcakam likhanam uktam vajrāvalyām
translated: But for the painted pavilions, the dharma source, which is the form of the dharma realm, or the indication included within the dharma realm, is described in the Vajrāvalī.

original: yathā bāhyaṃ tathādhyātmam ity utpannakramamaṇḍalapratipādanākṛtena lokadhātoś cakravāḍasūcakaṃ vajrāvalīlikhanaṃ ca niyamenaiva /
analyzed: yathā bāhyam tathā adhyātmam iti utpanna krama maṇḍala pratipādana ākṛtena lokadhātoḥ cakravāḍa sūcakam vajra āvalī likhanam ca niyamena eva
translated: As it is externally, so it is internally. For the sake of teaching the sequence of arising and the maṇḍala, the drawing of the vajra line indicating the Cakravāḍa of the world realm is done with certainty.

analyzed: na evam rakṣā cakram atas na likhyate
translated: But the protection wheel is not like that, so it is not drawn.

original: vighnanivāraṇaṃ tv anyathā kriyate /🔽api ca śūnyataiva bhagavatī nikhilavighnaughaṃ samūlam unmūlayituṃ prabhavatīti tadadhimokṣadṛḍhatvam evādarotpādanāya rakṣācakralikhanaṃ na
analyzed: vighna nivāraṇam tu anyathā kriyate  api ca śūnyatā eva bhagavatī nikhila vighna ogham sa mūlam unmūlayitum prabhavati iti tad adhimokṣa dṛḍha tvam evā ādara utpādanāya rakṣā cakra likhanam na
translated: But the prevention of obstacles is done in another way.

analyzed: varṇitam lekhya maṇḍaleṣu
translated: Moreover, emptiness itself, the Blessed Lady, is able to uproot the entire multitude of obstacles along with their roots. Therefore, the firmness of conviction in that is itself the respect, so the drawing of the protection wheel is not described for the sake of generating respect in the painted maṇḍalas.

original: bhāvyamaṇḍaleṣu tu kvacid eva tadbhāvanoktā na sarveṣu /
analyzed: bhāvya maṇḍaleṣu tu kvacid eva tad bhāvanā uktā na sarveṣu
translated: But in the cultivated maṇḍalas, it is mentioned in some places, but not in all.

original: vighnaghātānantaraṃ śūnyatāpraveśād bhāvyamaṇḍale 'pi rakṣācakraṃ nāsty ato na likhyate caitat /
analyzed: vighna ghāta anantaram śūnyatā praveśāt bhāvya maṇḍale rakṣā cakram nā asti atas na likhyate ca etat
translated: And in the cultivated maṇḍala, the protection wheel is not present because of the entry into emptiness after the destruction of obstacles, so it is not drawn.

original: evaṃ tarhi vajraprākāram api cakravāḍasūcakaṃ na likhitavyam /
analyzed: evam tarhi vajra prākāram api cakravāḍa sūcakam na likhitavyam
translated: If it is so, then the vajra fence indicating the Cakravāḍa should not be drawn.

analyzed: atha kūṭāgāra utpattau am
translated: But when the peaked dwelling arises,

analyzed: tat utpadyate
translated: it arises from that.

original: nahi bhagavatā vajraprākārasya dvitīyavārotpattiḥ kvacid uktā //
analyzed: nahi bhagavatā vajra prākārasya dvitīya vāra utpattiḥ kvacid uktā
translated: For the Blessed One has not said anywhere that the vajra fence arises a second time.

analyzed: kim vā dvis utpattyā
translated: Or, what is the use of a second arising?

original: sakṛd utpannam eva hi vajrabhūbandhaprākārādikaṃ samastasamāropaśūnyatāsvabhāvaṃ māyāmayam avatiṣṭhata eva /
analyzed: sakṛt utpannam eva hi vajra bhū bandha prākāra ādikam samasta samāropa śūnyatā svabhāvam māyā mayam avatiṣṭhate eva
translated: For, indeed, the vajra ground, enclosure, and so on, which have arisen once, remain as illusion-like, empty of the nature of all superimpositions.

analyzed: vidyamāna tve pi rakṣā cakrasya maṇḍaleṣu a likhana upattiḥ uktā eva
translated: Even if the protection wheel exists, the reason for not drawing it in the maṇḍalas has been stated.

original: kaiścit tu kvacid rakṣācakram api likhituṃ saṃmanyate //
analyzed: kaiścid tu kvacid rakṣā cakram api likhitum saṃmanyate
translated: But some allow the protection wheel to be drawn somewhere.

analyzed: iti mañju vajra maṇḍalam
translated: Thus, the Mañjuvajra maṇḍala.
